newsitem.title: USA: Henry Schein to buy Sullivan in stock swap.
newsitem.headline: Henry Schein to buy Sullivan in stock swap.

text.p: Henry Schein Inc will acquire Sullivan Dental Products Inc in a stock swap valued at about $318 million, the two companies said Monday.

Under terms of the definitive merger agreement, Henry Schein would exchange 0.735 of a share for each share of Sullivan Dental. The $318 million value is based on Henry Schein's closing price on August 1, the companies said.
Henry Schein said it expects a non-recurring charge related to the transaction in 1997.
The merger will be accounted for as a pooling of interests and is expected to be tax-free to Sullivan Dental's shareholders and accretive to Henry Schein's earnings in 1998.
The companies expect to close the merger in the fourth quarter.
Following the merger, Henry Schein will have 1996 pro forma revenues of more than $1.2 billion.
Henry Schein is a direct marketer of healthcare products and services to office-based healthcare practitioners.
Sullivan Dental is a distributor of dental supplies and dental equipment.
